instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Board has no video on external monitor nor on built in screen.
I have nothing on <SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>.
The computer is booting up because I hear the chime. The fan spins up really fast after 1 to 2 minutes. 
Where else should I look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
Any history available?
You should try to confirm USB activity.
I hope the board doesn't get stuck after chime.
Caps Lock light reacts?

Do you get 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_SW_LCD_CONN</SIGNAL>, at least in the first seconds (when chimes)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
I get 3.29 on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD_CONN</SIGNAL>. Does that seem a little low? 5V looks good. Both have voltage the entire 10 seconds of testing, I do not see them drop at all.
Caps lock light stays illuminated the entire time after booting up. USB activity is there too.
I don't have history on the board but I can tell it has come in contact with liquid at some point. Some damage was around UL000.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Video
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>3V3_SW_LCD_CONN</SIGNAL> is there, then <SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> must go high.
If not, you have a problem with the screen.
Test with known good screen assembly.

Check diode mode to ground on all data lines of JP600.
